title: Our pledge to diversify the space industry workforce continues | Open Letter
summary: The results from the first year of Space Workforce 2030 activity are in and we are trending in a positive direction. We are optimistic about our path forward, even as we remain realistic about the challenges we face and the work still to be done to make space more representative of everyone—by and beyond the year 2030.

title: SpaceX Starship completes first successful test flight
summary: SpaceX’s Starship completed its first successful flight test with an incredible liftoff at South Padre Island, Texas, after years of testing and...

title: Starship lifts off on first integrated test flight, breaks apart minutes later
summary: SpaceX’s first integrated Starship vehicle lifted off on a long-anticipated test flight April 20, only to tumble and break apart minutes later.

title: NASA starts consortium for ISAM technologies
summary: NASA announced April 19 the creation of a new organization devoted to advancing technologies for in-space servicing, assembly and manufacturing (ISAM).

title: SpaceX prepares for another Starship test flight attempt
summary: For the second time this week, SpaceX is preparing for the maiden test flight of Starship, the company’s most ambitious rocket to...

title: SpaceX launches its massive Starship rocket for the first time [Updated]
With a new medium rocket, Firefly plans to compete for national security launches
summary: Firefly Aerospace says its future medium rocket it is developing with Northrop Grumman will be ready to compete in the next round of U.S. national security launch contracts.

title: Starship conducts maiden launch – clears launch site and first stage flight
summary: The most powerful rocket in history launched on its second attempt Thursday, the first major step to making life multi-planetary. Liftoff of Starship from Starbase, Texas came after an uneventful countdown, with only a couple of short holds before roaring off the launch mount.

title: NASA Creates In-Space Servicing, Assembly, Manufacturing Consortium
summary: NASA announced Wednesday a new consortium focused on making in-space servicing, assembly, and manufacturing (ISAM) capabilities a routine part of space architectures and mission lifecycles.

title: Space investors see a return in industry growth capital
summary: Investment activity is picking up again for young space companies as growth-stage capital returns following market uncertainty in 2022, according to investors on an April 18 Space Symposium panel.
